intro: Pleurospermum rockii, commonly known as the rock pleurospermum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, often blooming in late summer, adding a subtle ornamental value to its natural habitat.
